title: Rossi et al.'s Criminal Recidivism Data
description:
Description
This data set is originally from Rossi et al. (1980), and is used as an example
in Allison (1995). The data pertain to 432 convicts who were released from
Maryland state prisons in the 1970s and who were followed up for one
year after release. Half the released convicts were assigned at random to
an experimental treatment in which they were given financial aid; half did not
receive aid.
reference:
Allison, P.D. (1995). Survival Analysis Using the SAS System: A Practical Guide.
Cary, NC: SAS Institute.

parameters.week:
week of first arrest after release or censoring; all censored
observations are censored at 52 weeks.
parameters.prio: number of convictions prior to current incarceration.
parameters.paro: released on parole? no or yes.
parameters.wexp: full-time work experience before incarceration: no or yes.
parameters.emp1: employment status in the first week after release: no or yes.
parameters.mar: marital status at time of release: married or not married.
parameters.age: in years at time of release.

format: A data frame with 432 observations on the following 62 variables.
